title: Speak French at the supermarket
description:
You want to improve your "daily French"?

Then we are going to experience concrete situations during Summer time. Today, we are going at the supermarket and we will do everything in French.

**THE SESSION:**
This is a face-to-face conversation based session lasting 90 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

The whole session happens in French and is dedicated to French speakers with a mixed level (from Intermediate to advanced) (if not sure, send a message to the organiser).

The tutor will lead the session in a public environment. He will help you to structure and improve your phrasing, and to develop your understanding.

Of course, attendees will interact and be able to ask questions.

We will meet at the place at the begining of the session. The tutor will give you a sheet with adapted vocabulary. Please bring a notebook and a pen to be able to write done things.

We will end the session with a chit-chat on site or a cafe nearby.

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space, to get the Bank details for payment and to be able to get the text.

**PRICING:**
You can pay each time or by block (then you save money)
This is included in the Conversation Class offer
\- £15 per session \(to be paid by bank transfer in advance or in cash at the begining of the class \- Bank details on request\)
\- £60 for 6 sessions \(to be used within 3 months \- to be paid in advance by bank transfer \- Bank details on request\)

If, after your first attendance, you decide to subscribe to the offer of £60 for 6 classes, you add £45 and then you incorporate your first class in the subscription.

The pricing is made to encourage you to attend more regularly as improvements will come with regularity.

**TERMS & CONDITIONS**
If you are to join, you are more than welcome to sign up. But, please, if you have an unforeseen hitch, up date your status as soon as possible. As there are only 6 spaces, if you don't turn up, someone else can't join. Thanks for helping.

For last minute cancellation, a message would be much appreciated. Fees will be requested or not refunded for late cancellation (less than 4 hours before the start). People who don't turn may be banned.

title: Speak French in Queen's Park
description:
We weekly meet at Queen's park cafe and speak French together. It is a friendly opportunity to speak French and to ask questions to a French native as well.

**THE SESSION:**
This is an in person French conversation session lasting 90 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

This is dedicated for any French speaker / learner with an Intermediate level or above. Attendees need to have some bases in French and a conversation level as the whole sessions is in French. If you are not sure, send a message (in French) to the organiser.

This is a very small group session: maximum of 6 attendees (minimum of 2). So you will speak directly to the tutor who enjoys handing over his passion for his country and his mother tongue. He will support you along the way to improve your speech flow.

The event consists of conversation and chats.

**IMPORTANT**

title: [online] FRENCH CONVERSATION CLASS (Rusty Intermediate) with a native tutor
description:
You want to improve your fluency, your pronunciation and your French skills? You want to get more vocabulary, knowledge and understanding of French, the French and France? You want to speak on various topics with the support of a French native tutor?

Each week, we come up to a different theme. It pushes your conversation skills up. It helps you to speak about many topics and to interact in French in multiple contexts.

Regular attendees learn a lot, make improvements and are able to have a chat about numerous topic!

The bonus, you will be able to ask questions to an authentic French native!

**THE CLASS:**
This is an online conversation class lasting 60 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

We will use "Zoom" for the session (link visible on Meet Up as soon as you sign to the session)

This is a Conversation Class dedicated to French learners who struggle to have a spontaneous conversation. If you think your French is rusty, if you feel not really comfortable to interact among a group of other French speakers, this class is for you (if not sure, send a message to the organiser).

The class goes on an adapted pace with a first part dedicated to a chit-chat and then we'll focus on a short text to learn about French culture and the language.

We approach the theme, read a short text ((you get a copy for the session by email - see below), speak, learn vocabulary and things about French culture. The theme is always linked to French, the French and France. At the end, we wrap up and keep a few minutes for some miscellaneous questions.

After the class, you will get an email with a list of vocabulary (some words / expressions seen along the class).

This is a very small group class: maximum of 4 attendees and a minimum of 2. So you will speak directly to the tutor.

During the class, the tutor helps you to structure and improve your phrasing, and to develop your understanding.

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space, to get the Bank details for payment and to be able to get the text

**PRICING:**
You can pay each time or by block (then you save money)
\- £15 per session \(to be paid by bank transfer in advance or in cash at the begining of the class \- Bank details on request\)
\- £60 for 6 sessions \(to be used within 3 months \- to be paid in advance by bank transfer \- Bank details on request\)

If, after your first attendance, you decide to subscribe to the offer of £60 for 6 classes, you add £45 and then you incorporate your first class in the subscription. The pricing is made to encourage you to attend more regularly as improvements will come with regularity.

**TERMS & CONDITIONS**
If you are to join, you are more than welcome to sign up. But, please, if you have an unforeseen hitch, up date your status as soon as possible. As there are only 6 spaces, if you don't turn up, someone else can't join. Thanks for helping.

title: [online] FRENCH CONVERSATION CLASS (for Intermediate) with a native tutor
description:
You want to improve your fluency, your pronunciation and your French skills? You want to get more vocabulary, knowledge and understanding of French, the French and France? You want to speak on various topics with the support of a French native tutor?

Each week, we come up to a different theme. It pushes your conversation skills up. It helps you to speak about many topics and to interact in French in multiple contexts.

Regular attendees learn a lot, make improvements and are able to have a chat about numerous topic!

The bonus, you will be able to ask questions to an authentic French native!

**THE CLASS:**
This is an online conversation class lasting 90 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

We will use "Zoom" for the session (link visible on Meet Up as soon as you sign to the session)

The whole class happens in French and is dedicated to French speakers with an Intermediate level (if not sure, send a message to the organiser). The tutor helps you to structure and improve your phrasing, and to develop your understanding.

During the class, first, we dedicate some time for a little introductory chat. Then, we approach the theme, read a text (you get a copy for the session by email - see below), speak, learn vocabulary and things about French culture. The theme is always linked to French, the French and France. At the end, we wrap up and keep a few minutes for some miscellaneous questions.

After the class, you will get an email with a list of vocabulary (some words / expressions seen along the class).

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space, to get the Bank details for payment and to be able to get the text.

**PRICING:**
You can pay each time or by block (then you save money)
\- £15 per session \(to be paid by bank transfer in advance or in cash at the begining of the class \- Bank details on request\)
\- £60 for 6 sessions \(to be used within 3 months \- to be paid in advance by bank transfer \- Bank details on request\)

If, after your first attendance, you decide to subscribe to the offer of £60 for 6 classes, you add £45 and then you incorporate your first class in the subscription.

The pricing is made to encourage you to attend more regularly as improvements will come with regularity.

**TERMS & CONDITIONS**
If you are to join, you are more than welcome to sign up. But, please, if you have an unforeseen hitch, up date your status as soon as possible. As there are only 6 spaces, if you don't turn up, someone else can't join. Thanks for helping.

For last minute cancellation, a message would be much appreciated. Fees will be requested or not refunded for late cancellation (less than 4 hours before the start). People who don't turn may be banned.

Follow French London Experience
[http://www.facebook.com/frenchlondonexperience/](http://www.facebook.com/frenchlondonexperience/)
[https://www.instagram.com/frenchlondonexperience/](https://www.instagram.com/frenchlondonexperience/)

title: [online] French conversation for Proficient
description:
This online Conversation session is exclusively dedicated to Proficient French speakers (TO BE PREVIOUSLY AGREED WITH THE TUTOR).

If you join the session without the required level, the tutor will ask you to leave the session at the begining with no refund.

You want to keep your fluency in French, to polish your pronunciation and to develop your French skills? You want to get more vocabulary, knowledge and understanding of French, the French and France? You want to speak on various topics with the support of a French native tutor?

Each week, we come up to a different theme. It pushes your conversation skills up. It helps you to speak about many topics and to interact in French in multiple contexts.

The bonus, you will be able to ask questions to an authentic French native!

The weekly session is online (zoom), lasts 90 minutes and occurs all in French. This is a very small group class: maximum of 6 attendees (with a minimum of 2 prebookings 24h before the start.

You will speak directly to a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London), who enjoys handing over his passion for his country and his mother tongue.

The session starts with a catch-up, then a chat on a topic with articles sent 24 hour in advance to the registered members (a different topic every week) and, at the end, a time is dedicated to share about new vocab, expressions and language issues.

We will use "Zoom" (link visible as soon as you sign up to the session)

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space and to get the Bank details for payment.

**PRICING:**
You can pay each time or by block (then you save money)
\- £15 per session \(to be paid by bank transfer in advance or in cash at the begining of the class \- Bank details on request\)
\- £60 for 6 sessions \(to be used within 3 months \- to be paid in advance by bank transfer \- Bank details on request\)

If, after your first attendance, you decide to subscribe to the offer of £60 for 6 classes, you add £45 and then you incorporate your first class in the subscription.

The pricing is made to encourage you to attend more regularly as improvements will come with regularity.

**TERMS & CONDITIONS**

title: Let's sing iconic French songs!
description:
Everyone knows one or another very famous French song!!!

Aux Champs Elysées, Douce France, La Vie en Rose, A la Claire Fontaine, Sur le Pont d'Avignon, Prendre un Enfant par la Main, and of course the famed Malbrough s'en-va-en guerre or some "variété française"

Curious?

We will sing some of them as an amateur French choir!!!
We will mostly sing a capella in a friendly atmosphere.
The tutor will bring lyrics and help you to get the meanings.

In the session, we will learn 4 or 5 songs that every French fellow knows. The idea is to gain a bit of the French culture, not necessarily the one you get in books, but the one that French people have.

Furthermore, singing is an amazing and efficient way to improve the pronunciation.

Please, bring what you need to be confortable in the park and during the whole session (water, rug, jumper, cushion, scarve...).

Feel free to come with a guest.

Once more, it is an amateur and friendly session. The goal is more
linguistic than musical. All welcome. No specific requirement, only to speak and read a bit of French.

**THE SESSION:**
This is a face-to-face conversation based session lasting 90 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

The whole session happens in French and is dedicated to French speakers with a mixed level (from Intermediate to advanced) (if not sure, send a message to the organiser).

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space, to get the Bank details for payment and to be able to get the text.

**PRICING:**
You can pay each time or by block (then you save money)
This is included in the Conversation Class offer
\- £15 per session \(to be paid by bank transfer in advance or in cash at the begining of the class \- Bank details on request\)
\- £60 for 6 sessions \(to be used within 3 months \- to be paid in advance by bank transfer \- Bank details on request\)

If, after your first attendance, you decide to subscribe to the offer of £60 for 6 classes, you add £45 and then you incorporate your first class in the subscription.

The pricing is made to encourage you to attend more regularly as improvements will come with regularity.

**TERMS & CONDITIONS**
If you are to join, you are more than welcome to sign up. But, please, if you have an unforeseen hitch, up date your status as soon as possible.

For last minute cancellation, a message would be much appreciated. Fees will be requested or not refunded for late cancellation (less than 4 hours before the start). People who don't turn may be banned.

title: Speak French in Queen's Park
description:
We weekly meet at Queen's park cafe and speak French together. It is a friendly opportunity to speak French and to ask questions to a French native as well.

**THE SESSION:**
This is an in person French conversation session lasting 90 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

This is dedicated for any French speaker / learner with an Intermediate level or above. Attendees need to have some bases in French and a conversation level as the whole sessions is in French. If you are not sure, send a message (in French) to the organiser.

This is a very small group session: maximum of 6 attendees (minimum of 2). So you will speak directly to the tutor who enjoys handing over his passion for his country and his mother tongue. He will support you along the way to improve your speech flow.

The event consists of conversation and chats.

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space and to get the Bank details for payment.

**PRICING:**

title: [online] FRENCH CONVERSATION CLASS (Rusty Intermediate) with a native tutor
description:
You want to improve your fluency, your pronunciation and your French skills? You want to get more vocabulary, knowledge and understanding of French, the French and France? You want to speak on various topics with the support of a French native tutor?

Each week, we come up to a different theme. It pushes your conversation skills up. It helps you to speak about many topics and to interact in French in multiple contexts.

Regular attendees learn a lot, make improvements and are able to have a chat about numerous topic!

The bonus, you will be able to ask questions to an authentic French native!

**THE CLASS:**
This is an online conversation class lasting 60 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

We will use "Zoom" for the session (link visible on Meet Up as soon as you sign to the session)

This is a Conversation Class dedicated to French learners who struggle to have a spontaneous conversation. If you think your French is rusty, if you feel not really comfortable to interact among a group of other French speakers, this class is for you (if not sure, send a message to the organiser).

The class goes on an adapted pace with a first part dedicated to a chit-chat and then we'll focus on a short text to learn about French culture and the language.

We approach the theme, read a short text ((you get a copy for the session by email - see below), speak, learn vocabulary and things about French culture. The theme is always linked to French, the French and France. At the end, we wrap up and keep a few minutes for some miscellaneous questions.

After the class, you will get an email with a list of vocabulary (some words / expressions seen along the class).

This is a very small group class: maximum of 4 attendees and a minimum of 2. So you will speak directly to the tutor.

During the class, the tutor helps you to structure and improve your phrasing, and to develop your understanding.

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space, to get the Bank details for payment and to be able to get the text

**PRICING:**

\- £15 per session \(to be paid by bank transfer in advance or in cash at the begining of the class \- Bank details on request\)
\- £60 for 6 sessions \(to be used within 3 months \- to be paid in advance by bank transfer \- Bank details on request\)

title: Summer FRENCH CONVERSATION CLASS (mixed levels) with a native tutor
description:
You want to push up your fluency, your pronunciation and your French skills? You want to get more vocabulary, knowledge and understanding of French, the French and France? You want to speak on various topics with the support of a French native tutor?

Along the Summer Classes, we will use support of games to push your conversation skills up. It helps you to speak about many topics and to interact in French in multiple contexts.

Regular attendees learn a lot, make improvements and are able to have a chat about numerous topic!

The bonus, you will be able to ask questions to an authentic French native!

This class is for French speakers with various levels, from Rusty Intermediate to Advanced.

**THE CLASS:**
This is a face-to-face conversation class lasting 90 minutes run by a French native & professional tutor (more than 6 years in London).

The whole class happens in French and is dedicated to French speakers with various levels, from Rusty Intermediate to Advanced (if not sure, send a message to the organiser). The tutor helps you to structure and improve your phrasing, and to develop your understanding.

During the class, first, we dedicate some time for a little introductory chat. Then, we approach the theme, read a text (you get a copy for the session), speak, learn vocabulary and things about French culture. The theme is always linked to French, the French and France. At the end, we wrap up and keep a few minutes for some miscellaneous questions.

After the class, you will get an email with a list of vocabulary (some words / expressions seen along the class).

**IMPORTANT**
If you are new to our Meet Up, please send ASAP an email at frenchlondonexperience at gmail dot com to introduce yourself, to check your level, to confirm your space and to get the Bank details for payment.

**PRICING:**
You can pay each time or by block (then you save money)
\- £15 per session \(to be paid by bank transfer in advance or in cash at the beginning of the class \- Bank details on request\)
\- £60 for 6 sessions \(to be used within 3 months \- to be paid in advance by bank transfer \- Bank details on request\)

If, after your first attendance, you decide to subscribe to the offer of £60 for 6 classes, you add £45 and then you incorporate your first class in the subscription.

The pricing is made to encourage you to attend more regularly as improvements will come with regularity.

**TERMS & CONDITIONS**
If you are to join, you are more than welcome to sign up. But, please, if you have an unforeseen hitch, up date your status as soon as possible. As there are only 6 spaces, if you don't turn up, someone else can't join. Thanks for helping.

For last minute cancellation, a message would be much appreciated. Fees will be requested or not refunded for late cancellation (less than 4 hours before the start). People who don't turn may be banned.

Follow French London Experience

title: [online] FLE Book Club
description:
Our very own book club is dedicated to Non Native French Speakers who want to take advantage of this experience to refine their French skills. Members must have at least an Intermediate level in French.

The whole session will be in French!

We will read books in French, books by French speaking writers.

We meet once a month (except July and December) for 1 hour / 1,5 hour and will talk (in French) about the book we will be reading.

The idea is to read a book (the same book for the whole group) on a slow pace, to be able to absorb most of it. We may adapt the pace on our way.

Along the session, we will talk about the writer, plot, story, characters, topics on one hand and about comprehension of the text, phrasing and vocabulary on the other hand.

We may read some passages during sessions as well. And of course, we will share our impressions and find out more about the themes.

The book club is a long-distance journey. Then, if you decide to join, you commit to a regular attendance for a few months at least!

Cost :
2 options :
£15 per session,
£60 for 5 months

When you sign up to one session, the payment (£15) will be processed through Paypal.

If you choose the option £60 for 5 months, please send me a message for details and make your payment (£60) by Bank transfer. Once payment processed, the organiser will put you on the list.

Once booked and paid, get the book as it is better to know about it if you are to attend the Book Club session.

title: Write & Shine - Westminster Quaker Meeting House
description:
Start your day with a burst of creativity!

Write & Shine workshops fit around your busy lifestyle. They offer a stimulating environment to write and to meditate on the inspirational power of the morning.

Allowing more time for imaginative thinking fosters innovation, increases productivity and encourages self-awareness. Great for both your professional and personal life!

For each session, writer Gemma Seltzer will guide you through a writing session, waking you up with words and energising you for the day ahead.

Write & Shine workshops take place in peaceful London locations, with the help of coffee, tea & delicious pastries. Sessions are suitable for new & experienced writers—or anyone wanting to incorporate creativity into their working lives. The price is just £10.

Book your place here. (http://write-and-shine.com/)

Upcoming locations & dates:

* Westminster Quaker Meeting House: Thursdays 7 & 21 April (7.15am arrival for 7.30am-9am workshop)

* Waterstones Piccadilly: Thursdays 14 & 28 April (9am arrival for 9.15am-10.45am workshop)

Find out more and book your place at http://write-and-shine.com/

Update: Just 3 slots left for class on 7 April!

venue.address: 8 Hop Gardens, off St Martins Lane (look for ‘Gymbox’ sign) WC2N 4EA

title: Write & Shine - Waterstones Piccadilly
description:
***

As a thank you for your support, we're offering Meetup subscribers a discount on upcoming workshops and online courses. If you’ve been thinking about coming but haven’t yet taken the plunge, now is your chance to try out a session. (http://write-and-shine.com/)

Just enter the code BIRTHDAY-5POUNDS (http://write-and-shine.com/programme/booking/)at the checkout (http://write-and-shine.com/programme/booking/)when you book and you'll receive £5 off your purchase.Something fun: the code will only be valid between 6.30am and 8.30am on Tuesday 19 July. Well, once you're up at that time, you may as well do a bit of writing...

***

Start your day with a burst of creativity!

Write & Shine workshops fit around your busy lifestyle. They offer a stimulating environment to write and to meditate on the inspirational power of the morning.

Allowing more time for imaginative thinking fosters innovation, increases productivity and encourages self-awareness. Great for both your professional and personal life.

For each session, writer Gemma Seltzer will guide you through a writing session, waking you up with words and energising you for the day ahead.

Write & Shine workshops take place in peaceful London locations, with the help of coffee, tea & delicious pastries. Sessions are suitable for new & experienced writers—or anyone wanting to incorporate creativity into their working lives.

The price is £12 per session. This covers room rental, refreshments and materials. Please book in advance to secure your place.

Book your place on the Write & Shine website. (http://write-and-shine.com/) Or via Meetup.

Upcoming locations & dates:

* Waterstones Piccadilly: Thursdays 28 July, 11 and 25 August (9am arrival for 9.15am-10.45am workshop).

* Westminster Quaker Meeting House: Thursdays 21 July, 4 and 18 August (7.15am arrival for 7.30am-9am workshop)

Find out more and book your place at http://write-and-shine.com/.

Write & Shine workshops fit around your busy lifestyle. They offer a stimulating environment to write and to meditate on the inspirational power of the morning.

Allowing more time for imaginative thinking fosters innovation, increases productivity and encourages self-awareness. Great for both your professional and personal life.

For each session, writer Gemma Seltzer will guide you through a writing session, waking you up with words and energising you for the day ahead.

Write & Shine workshops take place in peaceful London locations, with the help of coffee, tea & delicious pastries. Sessions are suitable for new & experienced writers—or anyone wanting to incorporate creativity into their working lives.

The price is £12 per session. This covers room rental, refreshments and materials. Please book in advance to secure your place.

title: Early morning writing retreat
description:
***Three places left - book soon!***

This Meetup offers a quiet and friendly environment for you to bring your work-in-progress or test ideas. Ideal for those of you who dream of time to write, but struggle to make space in your busy working life. Rather than a facilitated workshop, these sessions provide a morning writing retreat in the supportive company of other writers.

• Morning creative writing retreats in a beautiful & peaceful central London location

• 7.15am arrival for 7.30-9am writing retreat, allowing you to make time for your writing before the busy working day begins.

• Just £15 per session, including a light breakfast of hot drinks, fruit and pastries.

• Location: Quaker Meeting House, Leicester Square

• Time/date: Wednesday 7 December (7.15am arrival for 7.30-9am session).

Bring your work-in-progress and we'll provide breakfast, tables & chairs, plug sockets, wifi & a basket filled with writing prompts, creativity books and props for inspiration.

Limited places so please book soon (via Meetup, or the Write & Shine website: www.write-and-shine.com)!

title: Morning writing retreat on 27 July (on Zoom)
description:
**Writing Retreat**
**Wednesday 27 July (7.15-9.30am)**
Bring your work in progress or some ideas to explore and write together in the summer morning light – in the company of a friendly group of writers. We’ll offer a short intention setting exercise, because tomorrow’s new moon is a good time to plan and focus on new creative projects.

\*\*\*

Write & Shine offers a programme of early morning writing workshops, retreats, and an online library of self-guided courses.

During June and July, we’ll host morning writing workshops and events inspired by summertime’s warmth, light and colour.

The programme runs virtually via Zoom, UK time. A link to the Zoom meeting is sent by email 24 hours.

***

Our sessions are ideal for both beginners & those needed a burst of creativity as we don't share any writing produced. The focus is on generating new material and tapping into your imagination in the morning.

This workshop is £22. Please bring a notebook and a pen, or if you prefer to use a computer ensure it's fully charged!

Book in advance to secure your place. Book your place on the Write & Shine website. (www.write-and-shine.com) Or via Meetup.

Write & Shine summer artwork by Kate Zaremba.

***

Find out more at[ www.write-and-shine.com](www.write-and-shine.com).

title: Language of Colour - morning writing workshop on 28 July (on Zoom) SOLD OUT
description:
This session has sold out. Please contact Gemma on hello@write-and-shine.com to add your name to the waiting list.

\*\*\*
**Language of Colour**
**Thursday 28 July (7.15-9am)**

To close our season, we’ll host a special workshop on colour and language. We’ll look to writers Derek Jarman, Leanne Shapton, Ocean Vuong and Virginia Woolf who considered colour not just as decoration but as a tool to allow their imaginations to soar and bring their ideas to life.

\*\*\*

title: Summer Salon - 15-19 August 2022 (on Zoom)
description:
**Summer Salon**
**Monday 15 - Friday 19 August**

Join Write & Shine for a week of writing and inspiration this summer.

Write & Shine’s Summer Salon returns from 15 to 19 August 2022, with morning writing workshops and evening talks from artists on living a creative life and how they keep ideas flowing.

Guest speakers this year include graphic novelist and architect Sabba Khan and the poet, naturalist and wild swimmer Anna Selby. The week will conclude with a special event on generosity and creativity with writer and founder of the Astro Poets website, Dorothea Lasky.

The unique programme—offered online and led by writer Gemma Seltzer—aims to capture the edges of dreams and uncover all kinds of hidden ideas.

\*\*\*
Key details:

Date: Monday 15 – Friday 19 August 2022
Location: Online via Zoom, UK time.
Booking: £199 for the full week.
Find out more: [https://write-and-shine.com/summer-salon](https://write-and-shine.com/summer-salon)

This week is ideal for both beginners & those needed a burst of creativity as we don't share any writing produced. The focus is on generating new material and tapping into your imagination in the morning.

Book in advance to secure your place. Book your place on the Write & Shine website. (www.write-and-shine.com) Or via Meetup.

Write & Shine summer artwork by Kate Zaremba.

***

Find out more at[ www.write-and-shine.com](www.write-and-shine.com).

title: Critique Meeting Special Edition: "The Michaela Award"
description:
A critique meeting at the Horse & Groom. As usual we'll start with a chat, a bit to eat and/or pint before the meeting. We start the meeting proper at 7:00 with an update on the group and upcoming activities, with the critique starting around 7:15.

Note that this is the "The Michaela Award" (http://www.meetup.com/Science-Fiction-Fantasy-Writers-Group/events/227299026/) special critique edition, where members will be critiquing the submissions for our annual short story contest. Members who have RSVP'd to the meeting will be assigned at least one of the submitted stories to critique.

For this reason, RSVP will close on Feb. 18th (the sooner you RSVP, the sooner you will get your assigned story!) Also, please let me know as early as possible if it turns out you can't attend so your assigned story can be assigned to somebody else.

We will also be announcing the winner of the contest at the end of the meeting.

title: Spectrum Meets ... Peter Newman!
description:
Peter Newman, author of gripping and evocative fantasy novels including The Vagrant and The Malice, will be our guest author at the inaugural Spectrum Meets... event, where we invite authors and industry professionals to share their experiences, wisdom and knowledge with aspiring writers.

Peter is perhaps best known for The Vagrant, which just won the David Gemmell Morningstar Award and was shortlisted for a British Fantasy Award, and its recently released sequel The Malice. He is also a lead writer for Albion Online, the fantasy MMO, and co-writes the Hugo-nominated / Alfie-winning Tea and Jeopardy Podcast.

Peter will be reading from his new book, and then a Q&A session will follow. You will also have the opportunity to get your books signed!

The event will cost £5/person, and will include refreshments and nibbles. All are welcome, however space is limited so book early!

EVENT INFO
Social meet & greet: 6:30 PM

Reading + Q&A: 7:30 PM

Book Signing: at the end!

This event is brought to you by Spectrum: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group.

title: Spectrum Goes Rogue ... One!
description:
Spectrum heads out to see Star Wars: Rogue One!

Note: you should sign up by Thursday 6PM if you want to come ... you can cancel before then, but not after (as the ticket will be bought early to ensure we all get to sit close together or at worst in small groups).

3D theatre, Star seating. Tickets are £15 and will be bought/booked all together. I'm not including 3D glasses in case people already have them.

NOTE: TICKETS WILL BE PURCHASED ON THURSDAY NIGHT! If people register after that, I'll do my best to book them in as close to where the first group is sitting. So, ASAP as soon as you can!

The Cineworld in West India Quay is top shelf, big comfy seats. We'll head over to the pub afterwards for some food and pints as well. Only a few minutes walk from the DLR (West India or Westferry are the closest).

Should be a blast ... looks like this might be a real winner!

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Short Story Award Night
description:
The Spectrum Short Story Award Night will be a special critique session where all those lovely submitted stories (17 in all) will be critiqued and awards will be handed out for the favorites in each of five categories.

Note that to be eligible to attend this meeting, you will have had to have qualified to submit a story in the first place (i.e. been to a meeting in 2016 and had a chance to read the submitted stories). Stories will be critiqued in round-robin speed-date format, so that every submitted story will receive at least a few critiques. Critiques will be assigned to attendees a week before the meeting (2-3), so please sign up early.

Also, we'll be charging a small amount for this meeting to go towards the venue and the prize winners! Has always been a very fun night, so we look forward to seeing you there!

title: Spectrum Social ... going to see Logan
description:
Spectrum goes to see Logan, the farewell performance for Hugh Jackman's Wolverine and Patrick Stuart's Xavier. This looks to be a very much story- and character-driven movie, and pretty grimdark as well.

I will be booking tickets on Friday, so if you want to sit as a group, please book before then. I'll be booking for the 2D theatre, in the premium section (which are much more comfortable and well-positioned seats). The meetup fee (£13) is the price of the tickets.

As with previous events, all are welcome to join up for a meal afterwards.

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Novel Track ... First Meeting
description:
This will be the first meetup for our new Novel track. The meeting will revolve around discussing a suitable format going forward, looking at things like:

- meeting frequency

- critique format

- meeting format

- establishing reading/writing genres so that we can pair like-interest groups together

We'll send out a more detailed overview to the attendees before the meeting itself.

Note that the attendance requirements for this track will be more strict than our critique and other meetings. This is because there is a far greater commitment required in critiquing an entire novel (though it won't be as intensive as for a short story, i.e. don't expect to give or be given line item edits or per-page notes).

As such, the novel track meetups (including this one) will be restricted to participants who:

- have submitted and had their work critiqued at least once in the regular critique meetings

- are *actively* working on a novel (in process, complete, in revision, etc.). As spaces are likely to be tight, people who aren't actively contributing both content and critiques will likely be asked to give up their spot for somebody who is. We won't be militant about this, but we will be fair.

- are willing to commit to reading 5-10K/month (remembering that critiques for novels are not expected to be anywhere near as thorough as for short stories)

The idea behind this group is to be as much supportive/encouraging/inspiring as it is constructive (or maybe deconstructive).

So, if you want to contribute to the discussion of how we'll operate this group, join us on Mar. 15. Again, the above restrictions apply, so if you don't yet fit these requirements, please be patient and we'll find you a spot eventually!

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Novel Meetup
description:
The Spectrum Novel track is for writers working on ... well, novels. We meet once/month, discuss progress as a group, answer questions/solve dilemmas (generally plot problems, though maybe life/other as well) and then break off into structured micro-groups for critiques.

This meeting:

- everybody is asked to bring an elevator pitch of their novel, 100 words maximum. We did this off the cuff at the first meeting, lets see how we do when we have time to prepare (also, these are *hugely* important, so do take your time with it!)

- we'll be handing out the assigned micro-groups, which I'm sure will be an involved and exhausting experience

- we'll outline a general structure for micro-groups that will hopefully keep everybody productive and happy

-we'll break off into our new micro-groups for introductions and prep work for the meetings ahead

We typically start gathering at 6PM for food and/or a drink, with a start promptly at 7PM.

IMPORTANT: All novel track meetups are restricted to participants who have attended 2 or more of our regular critique meetings, no exceptions. Also, you must fill out the Novel Track Survey and be assigned to one of the micro-groups before attending (contact the organizers beforehand for details).

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Meets ... Den Patrick!
description:
For this Spectrum special event we will be hosting Den Patrick, author of the great Erebus Sequence and the War-Fighting Manuals, and co-creator of Super Relaxed Fantasy Club. He's training to be a therapist, which as writers we could all use a little of, and finally if not most importantly, he's a really nice guy!

Den has been a very important part of London's community of genre writers, and through SRFC has undoubtedly inspired many a writer to press on and complete their novels. He is also a guest lecturer at Brunel University for their creative writing course.

Den will be sharing his experiences with us on the trials and tribulations of writing novels, finding inspiration, the importance of community, among other wisdoms and truths. We'll be providing a selection of nibbles during the pre-gather chat, then Den will read a selection from his work and we'll follow with a question/answer period. All members are invited to attend.

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Critique meeting
description:
A critique meeting in the room upstairs at the Horse and Groom. As usual, you are welcome to arrive early and have a chat, a bite to eat and/or a drink before the meeting. General gathering starts around 18:00, meeting starts promptly at 19:00.

We should have two submissions to critique for this meeting, we will post them to the main Spectrum website as soon as they are ready.

If you are a new member, in order to access the submissions for this meeting, please register as a member on the main Spectrum website - www.spectrumwriters.com. Once your application has been processed you will be able to download the submissions from the website.

If there's a waitlist for the meeting and you're unable to attend, please remove your RSVP to allow other people to benefit from your place.

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Novel Meetup
description:
The Spectrum Novel track is for writers working on ... well, novels. We meet once/month, discuss progress as a group, answer questions/solve dilemmas (generally plot problems, though maybe life/other as well) and then break off into structured micro-groups for critiques.

We typically start gathering at 6PM for food and/or a drink, with a start promptly at 7PM.

This meeting:

- everybody is asked to bring a Hollywood pitch of their novel, 20 words maximum. Should include (or entirely be) of the format "it's like X meets Y", aka "it's like Mad Max meets Last of the Summer Wine" or "imagine Soylent Green as a musical, with killer robots"

- if anybody has a quick-discuss novel/writing problem they'd like to present to the group before we break off, please forward them to me or Rachel (question/description should be less than 100 words)

- we'll break off into our new micro-groups for critiques afterward

IMPORTANT: All novel track meetups are restricted to participants who have attended 2 or more of our regular critique meetings, no exceptions. Also, you must fill out the Novel Track Survey and have been assigned to one of the micro-groups to attend (contact the organizers beforehand for details).

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Social: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
description:
A Spectrum social event: off to the movies! In this case, Luc Besson's awesome spectacle Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets.

It's a bit spread out as far as people's availability, but this seems the best fit.

Price includes the ticket. I'll be buying these no later than Thursday evening, so please RVSP by then if you want to sit with the group!

For those holding passes, let me know and I'll put you on the RSVP list so you get any meetup notifications sent out.

Hope to see you all there!

- if anybody has a quick-discuss novel/writing problem they'd like to present to the group before we break off, please forward them to Grant or Rachel (question/description should be less than 100 words)

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Short Story Award Night!
description:
The Spectrum Short Story Award Night will be a special critique session where all those lovely submitted stories (16 in all) will be critiqued and awards will be handed out for the favorites in each of five categories.

Note that to be eligible to attend this meeting, you need to have qualified to submit a story in the first place (i.e. been to a meeting in 2017). Stories will be critiqued in round-robin speed-date format, so that every submitted story will receive at least a few critiques.

Critiques will be assigned to attendees a week before the meeting (2-3), so please sign up early!

Also, we'll be charging a small amount for this meeting to go towards the venue, an assortment of nibbles, and of course the prizes. Has always been a very fun night, so we look forward to seeing you there!

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Spectrum Critique Meeting (ONLINE)
description:
A critique meeting for short stories and novel excerpts written by our members. We will be critiquing one to two pieces at this session.

Due to the ongoing pandemic, we are still hanging out on Discord (voice/audio only). Instructions on how to join our server can be found here: https://spectrumwriters.com/members/discord-info

We will post the new submission(s) for this event shortly. Please wait until we have confirmed the new submissions are live before downloading anything. To access them, you need to sign up on our website and download it from the Members area under 'Submissions', then 'Upcoming Meeting'.

New members are absolutely welcome - please feel free to come say hello and see how the group works. An overview of how the critique meetings are formatted can be found on our website: https://spectrumwriters.com/about/critique-meetings/

*** PLEASE NOTE: This is not an instant virtual meeting like Zoom. You'll need to create a Discord account and join our server, which runs all the time, and then join the Voice Chat at the time of the session. Please allow extra time to complete this ahead of the meeting. ***

If you are having trouble getting onto Discord, signing up on the website, or have any other questions, leave a comment here and one of the organisers will get back to you.

Lastly, if you are able to, please consider tossing us a coffee's worth of change towards our running costs - it will be hugely appreciated! https://ko-fi.com/spectrumwriterslondon

Hope to see you there!

group.name: London Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers' Group

title: Write for your Life - writing session
description:
In advance of Monday's session, please have a think about something that has inspired you or helped you (self-help or otherwise). A book, a saying, a film, a song. We'll share these and maybe use some of them as prompts during our writing session.

In Write for your Life writing sessions, we'll use prompts to explore things like motivation, dreams and hopes, procrastination and much more. Workshops will be active, fun and occasionally stop us in our tracks.

Writing can be insightful, and we might share things we write (always optional), but please note, this is not a therapy group and isn't suitable for replacement of individual/group therapeutic work.

title: Write for your Life - writing session for self reflection
description:
In Write for your Life writing sessions, we'll be using writing exercises to uncover new perspectives and insights for ourselves on subjects like motivation, dreams and hopes, procrastination and much more. Workshops will be active, fun and occasionally stop us in our tracks.

The group will be limited to eight people, so please can I ask you to decline if you're no longer able to make it so someone else can attend. Many thanks!

Writing can be insightful, and we might share things we write (always optional), but please note, this is not a therapy group and isn't suitable for replacement of individual/group therapeutic work.

About me
I'm passionate about sharing free-writing and encouraging people to help themselves using this powerful tool. I am a coach and facilitator and use free-writing to help uncover sometimes surprising, but always useful perspectives and insights.

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Write for your Life - writing session for self reflection
description:
*Spaces often come up at the last minute so feel free to ping me if you're feeling spontaneous!*

We use free writing and discussion to explore different topics and themes around how we live our lives. This combination of writing and sharing never fails to connect those taking part in the joys and challenges of being human. It can also be a lot of fun and a great creative outlet.

Workshops are great for stress relief, personal reflection, uncovering different perspectives and sometimes surprising insights. It’s also a lovely way to celebrate your ‘you’-ness.

No writing talent, knowledge or experience - and definitely no grammar - is required.

The group will be limited to eight people, so please can I ask you to decline if you're no longer able to make it so someone else can attend. Many thanks!

Writing can be insightful, and we might share things we write (always optional), but please note, this is not a therapy group and isn't suitable for replacement of individual/group therapeutic work.

About me
I'm passionate about sharing life writing and encouraging people to help (and be OK with) themselves using this powerful tool. I am a coach and facilitator and use writing to help uncover sometimes surprising, but always useful perspectives and insights.

More info at: cpsdayoff.com

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Write for your Life Coaching Group
description:
A weekly coaching group to step off the merry-go-round and take a look at where you are in life and look at things you might want to start, stop, change or accept. Each week we’ll use writing exercises (no experience required) and discussion to dig into the area you’d like to look at. What you focus on is entirely up to you: work, creative endeavours, interests, purpose, relationships, finance, anything really. This doesn’t have to be about hard goals and knowing exactly what you want. It’s more about getting some perspective, seeing what your options are (realising that you have some), and giving yourself some space to work out what you’d like to do next, if anything.

One session might be enough, or you might feel the benefit of coming more regularly.

This group is not suitable for replacement of individual/group therapeutic work, but can be a great complement to it.

About me
I'm passionate about sharing life writing techniques including free writing, encouraging people to help (and be OK with) themselves and know that we’re never alone if we have a pen in our hand. I am a coach and facilitator and use writing to help uncover sometimes surprising, but always useful perspectives and insights.

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: New Year Workshop - Create your theme for the year
description:
Spaces still available if you're free last minute...

To book - please follow the link and sign up directly on Eventbright: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/write-for-your-life-new-year-workshop-create-your-theme-for-the-year-tickets-52863815094

This is a fun workshop where we’ll use guided writing exercises including free writing (no experience required) and discussion to reflect back and look forward, helping us to set our intention for the year ahead.

This workshop isn’t about creating resolutions or goals, though these do have their place. It’s more about capturing a feeling or a tone that can guide our decisions and help us feel that, whilst we might not always be behind the wheel, we’re at least in the front of the car. I've been using annual themes for nearly 10 years now and I can say that they have really helped me.

Free writing is a great tool for uncovering new insights and perspectives and a lovely way to celebrate your ‘you-ness’. No writing talent, knowledge or experience – and definitely no grammar – is required.

Details
Date: 12 January 2019
Time: 1-4pm
Cost is £25.00 (includes tea, coffe and biscuits)
Venue: Vauxhall Gardens Community Centre is less than a five minute walk from the tube/train/bus station.

There will be a maximum of 12 people at the workshop but as tickets are being booked through Eventbrite, I'll update the number of available slots as I go along, so the number here to sign up will change. I hope that makes sense.

Write for your Life - writing session for self reflection

We use free writing and discussion to explore different topics and themes around how we live our lives. This combination of writing and sharing never fails to connect those taking part in the joys and challenges of being human. It can also be a lot of fun and a great creative outlet.

About me
I’m a Life Coach and Facilitator, passionate about free writing, whether for self-reflection or to encourage writing itself.

I’ve been free writing for over five years and run regular workshops and coaching groups in London, for writing and for life.

I currently write Dear Lucy. Letters from one friend to another about every day life.

More info at: cpsdayoff.com

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Coaching Group for ANYONE who wants to write ANYTHING
description:
This session we'll be taking a look at 'Why?' Why we write, why we don't write and what we might do about it. There will be time to share what we're working on as well as a little time to do some writing after the session, if you'd like.

"Write Anyway"

Does this sound familiar? "I’m not a writer because":
• I haven’t written a book
• I don’t have a ‘process’/I have no discipline
• I've got nothing new to say
• I didn’t always know I wanted to be a writer
• I don’t write every day
• I’m rubbish at grammar
• Who do I think I am? I’m not good enough
• I’m not a creative person/I’m not allowed to be creative
• I can’t be a writer because I’m a *insert day job title here*
• People will mock/criticise/*insert your favourite insult here*

This coaching group is for ANYONE who wants to write ANYTHING. It’s about building confidence and finding out what's in the way of you writing/continuing to write and sharing your writing with others, if that’s what you want. It’s not about literary appraisal, writing technique or grammar.

A book, a letter, a blog, a journal, a sit com, a self-help book or a poem, whatever it is you want to write, I’ll help you to look at what's in the way and empower and encourage you to get/continue writing, and build the confidence to keep writing.

We’ll use free writing, discussion and a healthy dose of encouragement to explore different topics and themes around writing and creativity. We'll look at what your blocks are and come up with ways to move forward. There will be time at the end to continue your own writing if you'd like.

It doesn’t matter whether you’re standing at the station waiting for your writing journey to start, or are well into it with a packed lunch and a comfy seat. We can all benefit from a bit of encouragement and taking the time to invest in ourselves and our creativity.

"You will doubt yourself for not being good enough and have nothing new to say, Write anyway." (inspired by the Paradoxical Commandments)

Coaching Meetups will be £5 for a limited period. If you are unable to pay the fee, do drop me a line and we can sort something out.

About me
I’m a Life Coach and Facilitator, passionate about free writing, whether for self-reflection or to encourage writing itself.

I’ve been free writing for over five years and run regular workshops and coaching groups in London, for writing and for life.

I currently write Dear Lucy. Letters from one friend to another about every day life.

More info at: cpsdayoff.com

Does this sound familiar? "I’m not a writer because":
• I haven’t written a book

• I can’t be a writer because I’m a *insert day job title here*
• People will mock/criticise/*insert your favourite insult here*

This coaching group is for ANYONE who wants to write ANYTHING. It’s about building confidence and finding out what's in the way of you writing/continuing to write and sharing your writing with others, if that’s what you want. It’s not about literary appraisal, writing technique or grammar.

A book, a letter, a blog, a journal, a sit com, a self-help book or a poem, whatever it is you want to write, I’ll help you to look at what's in the way and empower and encourage you to get writing, and build the confidence to keep writing.

We’ll use free writing, discussion and a healthy dose of encouragement to explore different topics and themes around writing and creativity. We'll look at what your blocks are and come up with ways to move forward.

It doesn’t matter whether you’re standing at the station waiting for your writing journey to start, or are well into it with a packed lunch and a comfy seat. We can all benefit from a bit of encouragement and taking the time to invest in ourselves and our creativity.

Group is limited to 6 people.

"You will doubt yourself for not being good enough and have nothing new to say, Write anyway." (inspired by the Paradoxical Commandments)

Coaching Meetups will be £5 for a limited period. If it's difficult for you to pay for any reason, do drop me a line and we can sort something out.

About me
I’m a Life Coach and Facilitator, passionate about free writing, whether for self-reflection or to encourage writing itself.

I’ve been free writing and coaching for over five years and run regular workshops and coaching groups in London, for writing and for life.

I currently write Dear Lucy. Letters from one friend to another about every day life and the Accidental Sabbatical.

More info at: cpsdayoff.com

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Is Life Coaching for me? - Free/no obligation session
description: If you've ever thought about hiring a Life Coach, or want to find out what Life Coaching could do for you, come along and have your questions answered. Absolutely no obligation (this is not a sales pitch, it comes from a genuine desire for me to help people understand what help might be available for them). As well as answering your questions, there will be time to explore a little what you might like help with. I'll talk a little about the difference between coaching, mentoring, psychotherapy and counselling, how coaching normally works (length of session/duration/fees), and how to go about finding a coach. Feel free to come along or ask me any questions at cpsdayoff@gmail.com.

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Introduction to Creative Group Journaling/Life-writing
description:
Register in advance for this meeting:
https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZYtcO2rpjIuHNCYiLtIJ43Iroop2O48tmzy

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

Come along and experience the joy and value of writing and sharing with others at this free taster session. Journaling is incredibly useful and has many, many benefits. Journaling with others takes things to another level. As well as the accountability of writing with other people, we tend to write differently; often more, than we would on our own. Sharing is at the core of this session (in pairs). It doesn't have to be what you wrote word for word, it could just be how the exercise was for you and anything noteworthy you'd like to share. The writing prompts will help you to surface new insights and ideas, giving you clues as to what needs to happen in your life to get you where you want to be, or just to make it more enjoyable. Best of all, no writing talent, knowledge or experience - and definitely no grammar - is required.

This session will:

* A chance to 'try before you buy' (my other workshops)
* Give you some time, just for you
* Give you the opportunity to do some writing (from prompts)
* Give you some headspace, perspective and insight
* Connect you to yourself and others.
* Give you a lovely shared experience with like minded souls

It’s creative, supportive and fun, so why not come along and give it a go. You'll leave with some insights, some headspace and satisfaction of an hour well spent, in good company.

PLEASE NOTE you'll need to register via the Zoom link - this is for security purposes. Thank you.

These session are free, but if you'd like to buy me a coffee (or a Ko-fi!) click here: https://ko-fi.com/cpsdayoff thanks!

I've been running writing workshops and coaching for over three years and run regular sessions giving people the opportunity to write, grow and have fun together. If you'd like to chat about anything I offer, feel free to book in some time to chat: https://calendly.com/cpsdayoff/time-with-cp?

You can find more info at https://www.cpsdayoff.com/

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Journal/Write together - space to work on your own projects
description:
Give yourself some time and space to do some writing (anything - any level). There will be a little time to share what we're each working on and time to ask for help if needed but the main purpose of this session is to actually do some writing.

Register in advance for this meeting:
https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZ0odeyrqDguHtFs5GDYkSqxh8MUzAOUI1in
After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

Just being with other people (in whatever format!) can really help to get your pen underway. Anyone, any level, writing anything is absolutely welcome. It might be blurb for your website, a novel, a blog, a book for your child, a poem, anything.

These sessions will always be free, but if you'd like to buy me a coffee (or a Ko-fi!) click here: https://ko-fi.com/cpsdayoff
thanks!

Hope to see you there!

If you've not yet joined the Facebook group (for sharing writing, prompts, resources etc.) and would like to, here's the link: https://www.facebook.com/groups/763970184042640/

These sessions will always be free, but if you'd like to buy me a coffee (or a Ko-fi!) click here: https://ko-fi.com/cpsdayoff
thanks!

Hope to see you there!

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling
description:
It’s like journaling, but with other people! Trust me, it’s fun, energising, inspiring, supportive, rewarding and creative too.​

Journaling with others takes things to another level. As well as the accountability of writing with other people, we tend to write differently; often more, than we would on our own.

We use free-writing prompts to get writing. It could be a new season, a painting or National Penguin Day that we take for our inspiration in this session. It’s all just a place to start and then explore what comes through in our writing, whether that's creative, straight journaling or a combination of both.

Writing and sharing (always optional) never fails to connect those taking part in the joys and challenges of being human. It can also be a lot of fun and a great creative outlet.

Best of all, no writing talent, knowledge or experience - and definitely no grammar - is required.

Sessions are great for stress relief, building confidence, and uncovering different perspectives and sometimes surprising insights. It’s also a lovely way to celebrate your ‘you’-ness and realise that you're never alone when you have a pen in your hand.​

This session will:

* Give you some lovely 'you time' to connect with yourself, and others
* Get you writing - journaling/creative/both
* Give you headspace, perspective and insight
* Give you a lovely shared experience with like- minded souls

I've been running writing workshops and coaching since 2018 and run regular sessions giving people the opportunity to write, grow and have fun together. If you'd like to chat about anything I offer, feel free to book in some time to chat: https://calendly.com/cpsdayoff/time-with-cp?

You can find more info at https://www.cpsdayoff.com/

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Permission to be creative!
description:
Think you’re not creative? I’m here to tell you that you are, regardless of your job title. In this short talk, aimed at building your creative confidence, I’ll remind you how you're creative, every day - at work and at home - when it comes to ideas and solutions. I'll talk about what it means to have a creative mindset and why it’s important.

You’ll leave with permission to be creative, the courage to solve problems and take on opportunities and hopefully, the confidence to begin your own creative projects.

Register in advance for this meeting:
https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZctdOCsqz0pGtLGv9YdeyWh3hTeinYc9iQS
After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

I've been running creative writing and journaling workshops/coaching since 2018 and run regular sessions giving people the opportunity to write, grow and have fun together. If you'd like to chat about anything I offer, feel free to book in some time to chat: https://calendly.com/cpsdayoff/time-with-cp?

To find out more about how I enable and encourage people to be creative, go to https://www.cpsdayoff.com/

Also takes place on the following dates:
Thursday, 8 September, 12.30 - 1pm

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Write for your life PLUS - Creative group journaling
description:
It’s like journaling, but with other people! Trust me, it’s fun, energising, inspiring, supportive, rewarding and creative too.​

Journaling with others takes things to another level. As well as the accountability of writing with other people, we tend to write differently; often more, than we would on our own.

We use free-writing prompts to get writing. It could be a new season, a painting or National Penguin Day that we take for our inspiration in this session. It’s all just a place to start and then explore what comes through in our writing, whether that's creative, straight journaling or a combination of both.

Writing and sharing (always optional) never fails to connect those taking part in the joys and challenges of being human. It can also be a lot of fun and a great creative outlet.

Best of all, no writing talent, knowledge or experience - and definitely no grammar - is required.

Sessions are great for stress relief, building confidence, and uncovering different perspectives and sometimes surprising insights. It’s also a lovely way to celebrate your ‘you’-ness and realise that you're never alone when you have a pen in your hand.​

This session will:

* Give you some lovely 'you time' to connect with yourself, and others
* Get you writing - journaling/creative/both
* Give you headspace, perspective and insight
* Give you a lovely shared experience with like- minded souls

I've been running writing workshops and coaching since 2018 and run regular sessions giving people the opportunity to write, grow and have fun together. If you'd like to chat about anything I offer, feel free to book in some time to chat: https://calendly.com/cpsdayoff/time-with-cp?

You can find more info at https://www.cpsdayoff.com/

Picture by Asterisk Kwon on Unsplash/

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Coach yourself with a Pen - at work and at home
description:
**Takes place on 21 and 28 September. Both dates run** **from 6.30 to 8pm.**
Early bird £39 until 25 July 2022. Normal price £49.

**Coach yourself with a Pen - at work and at home**
Using techniques from creative writing, journaling, and coaching, you'll connect to yourself more deeply and work through your own live example. You'll leave feeling inspired and energised with some clear next steps and a set of new tools.

You may just have some fun too whilst tapping into your creativity, which will build your creative confidence. Everyone is creative when it comes to ideas and solutions and these tools will empower you to make the most of bigger opportunities and goals you'd like to achieve.

Bringing out your creativity is not only good for your wellbeing and your career (it's one of the most important skills companies need according to LinkedIn and other studies), but it can also give you meaning, help you to solve problems, be more curious about the world around you and ultimately, have a more enjoyable life and feel more confident.

The tools I'll introduce you to are easy to use, accessible 24/7, playful, creative and great for creating headspace, surfacing new perspectives and facing fear and anxiety to help you get what you want in your life. No experience, interest and definitely no grammar are required.

These tools are also great for divergent thinking and are really well suited for Design Thinking and Agile ways of working, whether for innovation or reaching goals. They can work with small or large challenges or goals and are suitable for all levels.

**Session one, 21 September**, will be about getting to the bottom of what's happening and what it is you want to achieve/overcome.
**Session two, 28 September**, will be all about looking forward to what you want and where you want to be.

Zoom details are revealed once you book.

I've been running writing workshops and coaching since 2018 and run regular sessions giving people the opportunity to write, grow and have fun together. If you'd like to chat about anything I offer, feel free to book in some time to chat: https://calendly.com/cpsdayoff/time-with-cp?
You can find more info at https://www.cpsdayoff.com/

*You're never alone with a pen.*

*Photo by Fabio Comparelli on Unsplash*

group.name: Write for your Life - Creative Group Journaling

title: Get to know each other & critiquing meetup
description: For the first meetup of Greenwich Writer's Group, we will meet at Gypsy Moth pub, which is by Cutty Sark tube station. Meet-ups are friendly and welcoming and each person is encouraged to bring along an extract of their work to receive constructive feedback. Each person is also encouraged to bring along a suggestion about a writing competition, opportunity or useful tip to share with the rest of the group.

title: Critiquing meetup
description:
After a great first meet up, it seems like a critiquing meetup at The Spanish Galleon would be a good idea (a quieter venue than the Gypsy Moth!). - If you would like your work to be emailed to attending members in advance for a more indepth critique, please email it to me zefstathiou@gmail.com and I will distribute it.
- If you'd prefer to just present your work to the group on the day, that's fine, but please bring copies. There will be a sign on the table stating Greenwich Writers.

title: Critiquing meetup
description: Please email an extract of your creative writing to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Friday 31st October so that I can distribute it to other members ahead of the meetup in order to give them a chance to reflect and come up with detailed feedback. We will then meet at The Spanish Galleon (opposite Cutty Sark) on Wednesday 5th November for a few drinks and to discuss each other's work and provide constructive feedback.

title: Critiquing meetup
description:
We are holding a friendly and constructive critiquing meetup on Tuesday 18th of November. Please send an extract of your writing (no more than around 2,500 words) to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Saturday the 14th and I will distribute it to everyone in the group to give us all a chance to reflect and come up with decent feedback.
We meet at The Spanish Galleon pub, opposite Cutty Sark station in Greenwich. We sit in the conservatory bit at the back. Note: The £5 charge goes towards covering the meetup organizer fees.

title: Critiquing meetup
description:
We are holding a friendly and constructive critiquing meetup on Wednesday the 3rd of December. Please send an extract of your writing (no more than around 2,500 words) to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Saturday the 29th and I will distribute it to everyone in the group to give us all a chance to reflect and come up with decent feedback.
We meet at The Spanish Galleon pub, opposite Cutty Sark station in Greenwich. We sit in the conservatory bit at the back. Note: The £5 charge goes towards covering the meetup organizer fees.

title: Critiquing meetup
description: Please email an extract of your creative writing to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Sunday the 14th December so that I can distribute it to other members ahead of the meetup in order to give them a chance to reflect and come up with detailed feedback. We will then meet at The Spanish Galleon (opposite Cutty Sark) on Wednesday 17th for a few drinks and to discuss each other's work and provide constructive feedback.

title: Writing together meetup
description:
Rather than critiquing eachother's work, we will just meet in The Spanish Galleon, bring our laptops (or notepads if you're feeling retro) and write together.

We will gather in the conservatory-style area at the back of the pub.

title: Critiquing meetup
description: Please email an extract of your creative writing to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Sunday 4th Januaryso that I can distribute it to other members ahead of the meetup in order to give them a chance to reflect and come up with detailed feedback. We will then meet at The Spanish Galleon (opposite Cutty Sark) on Wednesday 7th January for a few drinks and to discuss eachother's work and provide constructive feedback.

title: Critiquing meetup
description: Please email an extract of your creative writing to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Sunday 18th January so that I can distribute it to other members ahead of the meetup in order to give them a chance to reflect and come up with detailed feedback. We will then meet at The Spanish Galleon (opposite Cutty Sark) on Wednesday 21th January for a few drinks and to discuss eachother's work and provide constructive feedback.

title: Writing together meetup
description:
Having held our first writing together meetup earlier in the month, it seems like it would be a good idea to hold these meetups regularly as we all managed to get some decent work done.

The idea is that we meet in the conservatory area at the back of The Spanish Galleon opposite Cutty Sark in Greenwich and bring our laptops or notebooks and just write together.

Note: As we're spending quite a while in the pub, they do like us to buy food. We don't have a proper group meal but if you fancy a sandwich or desert at some point during the writing session, then you can order one.

title: Synopsis critiquing meetup
description: Rather than critiquing sections of each other's novels, at this meetup, we will discuss the synopsis of our plots, to determine whether the pacing is effective, the action gripping, if the ending is satisfying, etc. Please send your synopsis to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Saturday the 31st Jan so that I can share it with the rest of the group ahead of the meetup.

title: Critquing meetup
description:
Please email an extract of your creative writing to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Sunday 8th February so that I can distribute it to other members ahead of the meetup in order to give them a chance to reflect and come up with detailed feedback. We will then meet at The Spanish Galleon (opposite Cutty Sark) on Wednesday 11th February for a few drinks and to discuss eachother's work and provide constructive feedback.

We'll critique the first six extracts that come through as there usually isn't time to critique any more than that.

title: Writing together meetup
description:
The idea is that we meet in the upstairs area of The Spanish Galleon opposite Cutty Sark in Greenwich and bring our laptops or notebooks and just write together. Writing can be a bit lonely, so this way we make it more sociable and also force ourselves to get on with it!

Note: As we're spending quite a while in the pub, they do like us to buy food. We don't have a proper group meal but if you fancy a sandwich or desert at some point during the writing session, then you can order one.

title: Critiquing meetup
description:
Please email an extract of your creative writing to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Sunday 22nd February so that I can distribute it to other members ahead of the meetup in order to give them a chance to reflect and come up with detailed feedback. We will then meet at The Spanish Galleon (opposite Cutty Sark) on Wednesday 25th February for a few drinks and to discuss eachother's work and provide constructive feedback.

We'll critique the first six extracts that come through as there usually isn't time to critique any more than that.

title: Writing together
description:
The idea is that we meet in the upstairs area of The Spanish Galleon opposite Cutty Sark in Greenwich and bring our laptops or notebooks and just write together. Writing can be a bit lonely, so this way we make it more sociable and also force ourselves to get on with it! We all just work on our own projects- no set writing exercises or anything.

Note: As we're spending quite a while in the pub, they do like us to buy food. We don't have a proper group meal but if you fancy a sandwich or desert at some point during the writing session, then you can order one.

title: Critiquing meet up
description:
The purpose of this meeting is to provide and receive critique on extracts of your creative writing, whether you're working on a novel, screenplay, poetry, a memoir or short story, etc. We share our extracts via email ahead of the meeting to give us all a chance to read the work in our own time and reflect upon it, to come up with valuable critique.

You will find us in the conservatory area at the back of the pub. Please email your extract (approx 3000 words or under) to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Sunday 8th February so that I can share your work with the rest of the group.

title: Critiquing meetup

title: Write together
description:
The idea is that we meet up to write our own work in company.

We have changed the venue for our bi-weekly writing session. Spanish Galleon is pretty busy on Saturdays and can be fairly distracting so hopefully the Dial Arch with prove a better, more peaceful venue.

Just bring your laptop/notebook and enjoy a companionable afternoon with fellow authors.

description:

You will find us in the conservatory area at the back of the pub. Please email your extract (approx 3000 words or under) to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Sunday 5th April so that I can share your work with the rest of the group.

title: The idea is that we meet up to write our own work in company.
description:
Apologies for posting the wrong date first time around

The Dial Arch Pub is in Woolwich. here is the link http://www.dialarch.com/

Bring your laptop and write in convivial company.

title: Write together
description: The idea is that we meet up and write together - working on and focusing on our own projects but in convivial company.

title: Critiquing meetup
description:
The purpose of this meeting is to provide and receive critique on extracts of your creative writing, whether you're working on a novel, screenplay, poetry, a memoir or short story, etc. We share our extracts via email ahead of the meeting to give us all a chance to read the work in our own time and reflect upon it, to come up with valuable critique.

You will find us in alcove to the right of the entrance. Please email your extract (approx 3000 words or under) to zefstathiou@gmail.com by Saturday before the meetup so that I can share your work with the rest of the group. I'll share the first 4 extracts I receive.

When discussing each extract, we will go round the group, giving each person the opportunity to share their thoughts and feedback. This way we ensure that we stay focused, everyone has a chance to provide input, and the quality of critique is really thorough.

The group is friendly and relaxed, so please don't feel nervous about sharing your work if you are new!
